“Maasanam Margasheershoham,” says Sri Krishna in the Vibhuti Yoga of the Bhagavad Gita.

In this chapter Sri Krishna speaks of everything that is the best, in the form of which he is manifest and among the 12 months of the year, the best month is Margazhi, from mid December to mid January of the lunar calendar.

What makes the Margazhi season special for devotion? It is the time of the winter solstice when the days are shorter and the nights are longer.

What is the spiritual significance? It is believed, for the Gods, one year of ours isa day and the period of Margazhi is the pre-dawn moment when Ushas, the deity of dawn, is just about to emerge which forms an ideal time for meditation and contemplation on one’s divine self.

What is the scientific significance? It has been proven scientifically that the OZONE layer will be closest to the earth during the month of Marghazi,so breathing the fresh early morning air adds to healthy living in the margazhi month.

Chanting, singing and fasting are all different forms of Yoga that keep us in synchrony with that divinity which is a part of us. It is believed to be one of the reasons for the great music season in Chennai and early morning Bhajans in almost all temples.

As we have been doing in the last few years, one verse of Thiruppavai is uploaded on the website on a daily basis. Let’s hear and chant Thiruppavai and get the blessings of Andal (Maha Lakshmi Swaroopam) and Maha Vishnu.
